commit_message:
Fix _check_network_external_connectivity in test_network_basic_ops

TestNetworkBasicOps.test_network_basic_ops failed when there were
more than one ipv4 subnets in public network. This patch is to fix
it.

Change-Id: I1d385528afb600b8e6131cb59905ba1e8eff130d
Closes-Bug: #1637050

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2017-02-03 10:39:59.000000000', 'files': ['roles/tripleo-inventory/templates/get-overcloud-nodes.py.j2'], 'message': "Fix initialization of novaclient

This commit applies fix from I106ee603e0853bbc2da4b99724e83587de3cb4ba
in oooq.

projectid argument of novaclient's(< 7.0) entry-point had several meaning
in case of different cases. It is not a user-friendly behaviour, so it was
fixed in 7.0 . Now projectid means project/tenant id in terms of keystone,
like it should be from the beginning.

tenant/project name should be transmitted viaa project_name or tenant_name
keyword argument.

Change-Id: If76afe56f3ff851089732748693f7d2dbd06e59e
Closes-Bug: #1654183
"}]
commit_message:
Fix initialization of novaclient

This commit applies fix from I106ee603e0853bbc2da4b99724e83587de3cb4ba
in oooq.

projectid argument of novaclient's(< 7.0) entry-point had several meaning
in case of different cases. It is not a user-friendly behaviour, so it was
fixed in 7.0 . Now projectid means project/tenant id in terms of keystone,
like it should be from the beginning.

tenant/project name should be transmitted viaa project_name or tenant_name
keyword argument.

Change-Id: If76afe56f3ff851089732748693f7d2dbd06e59e
Closes-Bug: #1654183

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-18 16:24:02.000000000', 'files': ['files/fuel-utils/functions.sh'], 'message': 'Nailgun status check should include http responses

Fuel-utils could be used for automation of some tasks
and it is crucial service status checks to be adequate.
It is not enough to check that nailgun is started
we also need to check that it accepts requests and
responds.

Change-Id: I587925a468283cf48e22dc8afef36d7674af9903
Partial-Bug: #1656872
'}]
commit_message:
Nailgun status check should include http responses

Fuel-utils could be used for automation of some tasks
and it is crucial service status checks to be adequate.
It is not enough to check that nailgun is started
we also need to check that it accepts requests and
responds.

Change-Id: I587925a468283cf48e22dc8afef36d7674af9903
Partial-Bug: #1656872

subject: Remove support for py34
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-02-08 02:35:25.000000000', 'files': ['setup.cfg', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Remove support for py34

The gating on python 3.4 is restricted to <= Mitaka. This is due to
the change from Ubuntu Trusty to Xenial, where only python3.5 is
available. There is no need to continue to keep these settings.

Change-Id: I2d8a2ceb58e94bbb6706ca21cadae2cbca322a92
'}]
commit_message:
Remove support for py34

The gating on python 3.4 is restricted to <= Mitaka. This is due to
the change from Ubuntu Trusty to Xenial, where only python3.5 is
available. There is no need to continue to keep these settings.

Add support for psutil<2.0.0

* Introduce module psutil_wrapper to handle backward compatibility.
* Lower psutil constraint to psutil>=1.1.1

This patch adjusts the CentOS installation process to use a package

Change-Id: Iba42de56b8c548d0defa61fad72d8211a08df9bc

commit_message:
Use COPR pkg for LXC on CentOS

This patch adjusts the CentOS installation process to use a package
from COPR rather than installing from source. This saves time and
avoids issues from compiling LXC from source.

The source installation tasks have been removed.

Change-Id: Iba42de56b8c548d0defa61fad72d8211a08df9bc

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2017-01-18 16:10:44.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/manifests/credentials_file.pp', 'deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/spec/defines/osnailyfacter_credentials_file.rb'], 'message': 'Ensure keystone endpoint is created before openrc

In puppet 4 keystone endpoint creation order is different
from puppet 3, keystone endpoint always should be created
before openrc is created because of [1].

This patch makes use of code [2] by adding openrc tag to
credentials file. This will ensure keystone endpoint is created
before openrc.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/puppet-keystone/+bug/1559292
[2] https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/puppet-keystone/commit/?id=ec8e0452b6846cb5b571307189b46f2488b35ae8

Change-Id: I074db94b295a1e71309dbf949fc5f6c82dfbef9f
Closes-Bug: #1656327
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure keystone endpoint is created before openrc

In puppet 4 keystone endpoint creation order is different
from puppet 3, keystone endpoint always should be created
before openrc is created because of [1].

This patch makes use of code [2] by adding openrc tag to
credentials file. This will ensure keystone endpoint is created
before openrc.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/puppet-keystone/+bug/1559292
[2] https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/puppet-keystone/commit/?id=ec8e0452b6846cb5b571307189b46f2488b35ae8

Change-Id: I074db94b295a1e71309dbf949fc5f6c82dfbef9f
Closes-Bug: #1656327

This patch adds the team's and repository's badges to the README file.
The motivation behind this is to communicate the project status and
features at first glance.

For more information about this effort, please read this email thread:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-October/105562.html

commit_message:
Show team and repo badges on README

This patch adds the team's and repository's badges to the README file.
The motivation behind this is to communicate the project status and
features at first glance.

For more information about this effort, please read this email thread:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-October/105562.html

To see an example of how this would look like check:

https://gist.github.com/e409a5beedf590fb3e83a7d9772e4e64

Change-Id: Icf30f0c83f3d9cfbdf7352fa85411e9b1a6e6d8a

subject: Actually report gate failures for experimental jobs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-08 10:26:38.000000000', 'files': ['tools/setup_gate.sh'], 'message': 'Actually report gate failures for experimental jobs

Some experimental jobs are not implemented.  Report gate failures
for these to encourage folks to get around to implementing them
rather then thinking everthing is rosy.

Some experimental jobs are not implemented.  Report gate failures
for these to encourage folks to get around to implementing them
rather then thinking everthing is rosy.

commit_message:
Handler for counting notifications statuses added

For calculation of notifications statuses we made requests in the UI
and fetch all notifications data and process them on the UI side.
We want to replace a polling of the whole notification collection by
a polling of unread notifications number. This dramatically decrease
Fuel UI load in case of a big amount of notifications.

Change-Id: I8f83d4e2d7f58beaf06c489b2264ccb69f9927ce
Partial-Bug: #1657348
(cherry picked from commit d4bf85957e13abecc519c84f43122e55df510eec)

commit_message:
Fix default approach for share group snapshot creation

Default approach uses common driver interface of single snapshot
creation. So, emulate it correctly providing all required keys.
Also add 'provider_location' attribute to share group snapshot
members DB model, because it is required for some drivers and
was absent.

Change-Id: If120d85ef3dd3ba90e2dc12a5b81b69feecb31ea
Closes-Bug: #1660321

subject: Make all linting tests use upper-constraints
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-08 06:43:11.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Make all linting tests use upper-constraints

As per [1] all linting tests can now use upper-constraints. This patch
removes all instances of the install_command override relating to lint
testing which were needed to negate the use of upper-constraints.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-August/101474.html

This is a modified backport of 46950a632870f19f83f02946408d769e35c3b683
which also removes the install_command override for functional testing.

Change-Id: I4cbd9a5baa0d4ae96c600af104146c47813ebc90
'}]
commit_message:
Make all linting tests use upper-constraints

As per [1] all linting tests can now use upper-constraints. This patch
removes all instances of the install_command override relating to lint
testing which were needed to negate the use of upper-constraints.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-August/101474.html

This is a modified backport of 46950a632870f19f83f02946408d769e35c3b683
which also removes the install_command override for functional testing.

Change-Id: I4cbd9a5baa0d4ae96c600af104146c47813ebc90

commit_message:
Pass mysql credentials to galera_status

In puppet 4 templates require variables to be
explicitly set in parent class scope.

This patch adds status_password and status_user parameters
to cluster::galera_status class so they can be available
for openstack/galera_clustercheck.erb template.

Closes-Bug: #1656249

Change-Id: Ie1a5d371fbe18a41f6b4b0f15e4076fd3dadfaca

subject: Do not complain in firewall_deleted if the FW is already deleted
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-02-06 23:20:35.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_fwaas/tests/unit/services/firewall/test_fwaas_plugin.py', 'neutron_fwaas/services/firewall/fwaas_plugin.py'], 'message': 'Do not complain in firewall_deleted if the FW is already deleted

Currently firewall_deleted[1] crashs if the firewall is already deleted
or deleted concurrently during firewall_deleted call. We should avoid
such behavior as there is no reason to crash if someone already did the
job for us (ie: delete the FW).

Moreover such crash is costly because it triggers a service-sync on FWaaS
l3-reference agent (at least). Typically on a L3-DVR deployment, all
firewall_deleted calls except the first one will fail so quite every
L3-DVR will perform a FWaaS service-sync.

This change updates firewall_deleted in order to succeed if the firewall
is already deleted or if the firewall is deleted concurrently.

Such trouble also impacts FWaaS v2 and will be solved in a follow-up
change.

[1] neutron.services.firewall.fwaas_plugin.FirewallCallbacks

Partial-Bug: #1658060
Change-Id: I4df05f2026eb622662dad82e504d072639cdae48
'}]
commit_message:
Do not complain in firewall_deleted if the FW is already deleted

Currently firewall_deleted[1] crashs if the firewall is already deleted
or deleted concurrently during firewall_deleted call. We should avoid
such behavior as there is no reason to crash if someone already did the
job for us (ie: delete the FW).

Moreover such crash is costly because it triggers a service-sync on FWaaS
l3-reference agent (at least). Typically on a L3-DVR deployment, all
firewall_deleted calls except the first one will fail so quite every
L3-DVR will perform a FWaaS service-sync.

This change updates firewall_deleted in order to succeed if the firewall
is already deleted or if the firewall is deleted concurrently.

Such trouble also impacts FWaaS v2 and will be solved in a follow-up
change.

[1] neutron.services.firewall.fwaas_plugin.FirewallCallbacks

Partial-Bug: #1658060
Change-Id: I4df05f2026eb622662dad82e504d072639cdae48

Although the API documentation for nova [1] says to pass None to
indicate a volume that should not be used for booting, doing so produces
an error because None is not an integer. Change shade to use '-1' (to

[1] http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/?expanded=create-server-detail#create-server

Change-Id: I5732575501005f4acc6320578882a079adc8be38

commit_message:
pass -1 for boot_index of non-boot volumes

Although the API documentation for nova [1] says to pass None to
indicate a volume that should not be used for booting, doing so produces
an error because None is not an integer. Change shade to use '-1' (to
comply with the declared string type) instead of None.

[1] http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/?expanded=create-server-detail#create-server

Change-Id: I5732575501005f4acc6320578882a079adc8be38
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

At this point, Ansible will always die if the `tempest` command returns
a non-zero exit code. This behavior makes complicated the reuse of the
role in another playbook.
This commit adds a new variable called `tempest_exit_ansible_on_error`
that allow the user to turn this feature off.

existing code base.

Change-Id: I3b671f99d6226f39eb09b695fe244fb0dca5f0c0

commit_message:
tempest: keep Ansible running after err

At this point, Ansible will always die if the `tempest` command returns
a non-zero exit code. This behavior makes complicated the reuse of the
role in another playbook.
This commit adds a new variable called `tempest_exit_ansible_on_error`
that allow the user to turn this feature off.
The default value is `false` to preserve the compatibility with the
existing code base.

Change-Id: I3b671f99d6226f39eb09b695fe244fb0dca5f0c0

commit_message:
Add related bug#1659811 for tenant_id filter compute tests

Bug#1659811 on compute side when admin try to filter servers
with tenant_id but no all_tenant.

On Py3 it did not work due to hash randomization is enabled
by default on Py3.

This commit adds that bug as related bug in respective tests
for tracing the same in future.

Change-Id: I2ae66f257ef52972ff1143c92b30aa8acb27d4ab

commit_message:
Use tenacity instead of retrying

We are replacing all usages of the 'retrying' package with 'tenacity'
as the author of retrying is not actively maintaining the project.
Tenacity is a fork of retrying, but has improved the interface and
extensibility (see [1] for more details). Our end goal here is removing
the retrying package from our requirements.
[1] https://github.com/jd/tenacity

Co-Authored-By: ShuYingya<yingya.shu@easystack.cn>
Change-Id: I68b8f7abab0ca8ab3c15b346aebea261cc26486b
Closes-Bug: #1635384

commit_message:
Fix apt pins generation

In Puppet 4 null value in
yaml backend is treated as Undef symbol. This
behaviour causes generate_apt_pins() function
to create pins with zero priority.

Closes-Bug: #1655961

Change-Id: I1d2bf737e88bba37e08e19c0be1f86c74f1dbd5c

commit_message:
Allow to set allow_resize_to_same_host in nova-api

To be able to resize a ephemeral node, we need to set
allow_resize_to_same_host to true in nova-api.

By default the value will be set to false as the openstack default.

Co-Author: Cyril Lopez <cylopez@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Idc5710d72c3dcffdd34eb1b7203c47b681b44c53
Closes-bug: #1535606
(cherry picked from commit 455d69ae1838f4ec8acc782edf5c07b66d51adb7)

commit_message:
Fix role validation in release PUT handler

Plugins' roles can be assigned to some nodes, so we can't
assume that release roles is be a superset of node roles
everywhere.

So check that there are no nodes in all clusters, which
have roles assigned, that we are trying to delete.

Forward-port of 78fbccc9ac1fad1f05bfc9e68677d4ef24b1a0aa

Change-Id: I28c23bd239ca150832323c8994788cb3aeb40eef
Closes-Bug: #1625592
(cherry picked from commit 981750eb6e6590e02342dc6fd841a0ded1fdb521)

subject: Fix timing test error when rebalancing
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-08 09:01:40.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/cli/test_ringbuilder.py'], 'message': 'Fix timing test error when rebalancing

The reported timing can be 00:59:59 sometimes, but is still valid. This
will fail in the tests, as seen in [1].

This patch fixes this by mocking the current time, ensuring that the
first two rebalances happen at the same time.

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/97/337297/32/check/gate-swift-python27-ubuntu-xenial/46203f1/console.html#_2017-02-08_07_28_42_589176

Change-Id: I0fd43d5bb13d0e88126f4f6ba14fb87faab6df9c
'}]
commit_message:
Fix timing test error when rebalancing

The reported timing can be 00:59:59 sometimes, but is still valid. This
will fail in the tests, as seen in [1].

This patch fixes this by mocking the current time, ensuring that the
first two rebalances happen at the same time.

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/97/337297/32/check/gate-swift-python27-ubuntu-xenial/46203f1/console.html#_2017-02-08_07_28_42_589176

Change-Id: I0fd43d5bb13d0e88126f4f6ba14fb87faab6df9c

commit_message:
Fix DB migration with postgresql

Check if a table already exists before creating it. This prevents the errors:

INFO migrate.versioning.api [designate-manage - - - - -] 69 -> 70...
CRITICAL designate [designate-manage - - - - -] ProgrammingError: \
         (psycopg2.ProgrammingError) type "resource_statuses" already exists

INFO migrate.versioning.api [designate-manage - - - - -] 85 -> 86...
CRITICAL designate [designate-manage - - - - -]
         ProgrammingError: (psycopg2.ProgrammingError) relation
         "unique_pool_host_port" already exists

INFO migrate.versioning.api [designate-manage - - - - -] 96 -> 97...
CRITICAL designate [designate-manage - - - - -]
         ProgrammingError: (psycopg2.ProgrammingError) type "service_statuses"
         already exists

ERROR designate ProgrammingError: (psycopg2.ProgrammingError) type
      "service_statuses" already exists
ERROR designate
      HINT:  A relation has an associated type of the same name, so you must
      use a name that doesn't conflict with any existing type.

when running the migration with postgresql.

Closes-Bug: #1640453
Change-Id: I3e8928c1b92d5c42e634abb992a4d931c44be01b
(cherry picked from commit 3a8452c65d7b89d4d5b1b87fba63a84239a2b342)

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-02-08 10:25:21.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/misc.yml'], 'message': "Handle SELinux properly when it is disabled

This patch skips the `find` task that searches for unlabeled content on
systems with SELinux disabled. This fails because labels aren't loaded at that
time.

Manual partial backport from I7d30a07bd7e8a4461846660c281b9e53b0783461.

Change-Id: I85d02d6a20c98f1a3d507d9957b9f4d9438412a9
Closes-bug: 1649617
"}]
commit_message:
Handle SELinux properly when it is disabled

This patch skips the `find` task that searches for unlabeled content on
systems with SELinux disabled. This fails because labels aren't loaded at that
time.

Manual partial backport from I7d30a07bd7e8a4461846660c281b9e53b0783461.

Change-Id: I85d02d6a20c98f1a3d507d9957b9f4d9438412a9
Closes-bug: 1649617

subject: Astute do not respect debug option for puppet task
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 8776, 'name': 'Vladimir Sharshov', 'email': 'vsharshov@mirantis.com', 'username': 'warpc'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 20656, 'name': 'Fuel Packaging CI', 'email': 'ci+fuel-packaging@mirantis.com', 'username': 'fuel-packaging-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 21013, 'name': 'Georgy Kibardin', 'email': 'gkibardin@mirantis.com', 'username': 'gkibardin'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-08 10:34:28.000000000', 'files': ['lib/astute/task.rb', 'lib/astute/tasks/puppet.rb', 'spec/unit/tasks/puppet_task_spec.rb'], 'message': 'Astute do not respect debug option for puppet task

Run cluster with enable debug option do not affect
puppet task which always run with debug disable.

It is happened because Nailgun send debug option which
Astute setup for every task, but puppet task required
puppet_debug option to control it behavior. This code
will connect this parameters.

Change-Id: I8df68105aa699e83673c39a0f03bb22673171d6f
Closes-Bug: #1662512
(cherry picked from commit 003a0a0efdbedf51fef943586286e00068175b43)
'}]
commit_message:
Astute do not respect debug option for puppet task

Run cluster with enable debug option do not affect
puppet task which always run with debug disable.

It is happened because Nailgun send debug option which
Astute setup for every task, but puppet task required
puppet_debug option to control it behavior. This code
will connect this parameters.

Change-Id: I8df68105aa699e83673c39a0f03bb22673171d6f
Closes-Bug: #1662512
(cherry picked from commit 003a0a0efdbedf51fef943586286e00068175b43)

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-11-07 17:00:03.000000000', 'files': ['handlers/main.yml', 'tests/test.yml'], 'message': 'Fix auditd restart handler

It is not possible to restart auditd with systemctl. Using the service
interface is required. There are chef cookbooks[1] with the same
workaround.

This patch also includes a `cache_valid_time` addition to test.yml to
unblock the gate.

Change-Id: I1aa3faf88f5953c230693600fcbcb786d49a35e0
'}]
commit_message:
Fix auditd restart handler

It is not possible to restart auditd with systemctl. Using the service
interface is required. There are chef cookbooks[1] with the same
workaround.

This patch also includes a `cache_valid_time` addition to test.yml to
unblock the gate.

[1] https://github.com/chef-cookbooks/auditd/pull/22/files

Change-Id: I1aa3faf88f5953c230693600fcbcb786d49a35e0

subject: Prepare for using standard python tests
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-03 18:26:46.000000000', 'files': ['tools/test-setup.sh'], 'message': 'Prepare for using standard python tests

Add simple script to setup mysql and postgresql databases, this script
can be run by users during testing and will be run by CI systems for
specific setup before running unit tests. This is exactly what is
currently done by OpenStack CI in project-config.

This allows to change in project-config the python-db jobs to
python-jobs since python-jobs will call this script initially.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-November/107784.html

Needed-By: I0d77bb798f61cd8ff756e7205fd034bb94789491
Change-Id: If11f4188db3aca2a2c253341505db95e8dc9ac6f
(cherry picked from commit 5bbcff998a33ea3697822810b6dff297fd335071)
'}]
commit_message:
Prepare for using standard python tests

Add simple script to setup mysql and postgresql databases, this script
can be run by users during testing and will be run by CI systems for
specific setup before running unit tests. This is exactly what is
currently done by OpenStack CI in project-config.

This allows to change in project-config the python-db jobs to
python-jobs since python-jobs will call this script initially.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-November/107784.html

Prepare for using standard python tests

Add simple script to setup mysql and postgresql databases, this script
can be run by users during testing and will be run by CI systems for
specific setup before running unit tests. This is exactly what is
currently done by OpenStack CI in project-config.

This allows to change in project-config the python-db jobs to
python-jobs since python-jobs will call this script initially.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-November/107784.html

Unpin rspec-core version in haproxy module

Pinned rspec-core 3.1.7 version in haproxy module is incompatible
with a new version of rake.

commit_message:
Log an error if no devices have been loaded

If no devices have been loaded, log an error message. If someone is
using network-generic-switch then they should have defined some devices.

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 3009, 'name': 'Vladimir Kozhukalov', 'email': 'kozhukalov@gmail.com', 'username': 'kozhukalov'}, {'_account_id': 8003, 'name': 'Aleksandr Gordeev', 'email': 'agordeev@mirantis.com', 'username': 'agordeev'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 20656, 'name': 'Fuel Packaging CI', 'email': 'ci+fuel-packaging@mirantis.com', 'username': 'fuel-packaging-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-19 17:34:25.000000000', 'files': ['fuel_agent/tests/test_partition.py'], 'message': 'Use assertIsNone(...) instead of assertEqual(None, ...)

Refer to:http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#unit-tests-and-assertraises

[H203] Use assertIs(Not)None to check for None (off by default) Unit
test assertions tend to give better messages for more specific assertions.
As a result, assertIsNone(...) is preferred over assertEqual(None, ...)
and assertIs(None, ...)

Change-Id: I9246fac952c59d3ddc1458c16c53fc988ac095d3
'}]
commit_message:
Use assertIsNone(...) instead of assertEqual(None, ...)

Refer to:http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#unit-tests-and-assertraises

[H203] Use assertIs(Not)None to check for None (off by default) Unit
test assertions tend to give better messages for more specific assertions.
As a result, assertIsNone(...) is preferred over assertEqual(None, ...)
and assertIs(None, ...)

Change-Id: I9246fac952c59d3ddc1458c16c53fc988ac095d3

The issue is that in python-fuelclient API has been
changed and fuelclient.client.APIClient is not available
anymore. It used to be a singleton of fuel client but
now it is deprecated. So, let's use APIClient.default_client
classmethod to instantiate APIClient.

https://github.com/openstack/python-fuelclient/blob/stable/newton/fuelclient/client.py#L51

Closes-Bug: #1620584

commit_message:
Change the way how we instantiate fuel client

The issue is that in python-fuelclient API has been
changed and fuelclient.client.APIClient is not available
anymore. It used to be a singleton of fuel client but
now it is deprecated. So, let's use APIClient.default_client
classmethod to instantiate APIClient.

https://github.com/openstack/python-fuelclient/blob/stable/newton/fuelclient/client.py#L51

Change-Id: I5287184c6f1c6abf8ac61894db0bd51fbf730401
Closes-Bug: #1620584

commit_message:
Remove support for py34

The gating on python 3.4 is restricted to <= Mitaka. This is due
to the change from Ubuntu Trusty to Xenial, where only python3.5
is available. There is no need to continue to keep these settings.

Change-Id: Ie62882defdafa745b222da345f130c7e618cb0d5

subject: Replace six.iteritems/itervalues with dict.items()/values()
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-06 09:28:55.000000000', 'files': ['dragonflow/tests/fullstack/test_objects.py', 'dragonflow/controller/l2_app.py', 'dragonflow/db/drivers/redis_db_driver.py', 'dragonflow/ovsdb/commands.py', 'dragonflow/controller/topology.py', 'dragonflow/controller/dnat_app.py', 'dragonflow/ovsdb/impl_idl.py', 'dragonflow/db/drivers/redis_mgt.py', 'dragonflow/cli/utils.py', 'dragonflow/db/drivers/zookeeper_db_driver.py', 'dragonflow/controller/sg_app.py', 'dragonflow/db/db_store.py'], 'message': 'Replace six.iteritems/itervalues with dict.items()/values()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using six.iteritems
to achieve iterators. We can use dict.items instead, as it will
return iterators in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys will more
readable.
2.In py2, the performance about list should be negligible,
see the link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: I1d260757c26449317e34367141bdbcfec7831647
'}]
commit_message:
Replace six.iteritems/itervalues with dict.items()/values()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using six.iteritems
to achieve iterators. We can use dict.items instead, as it will
return iterators in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys will more
readable.
2.In py2, the performance about list should be negligible,
see the link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: I1d260757c26449317e34367141bdbcfec7831647

commit_message:
Switch task parser to custom yaml

1.Switch task parser to custom yaml, custom yaml deprecates duplicate key
and loads task in the same order as they are in task file.
2.Remove duplicate scenario KeystoneBasic.create_delete_user.

Change-Id: I3b338f63eca0ac217a6376f6d6705da69fb97e80

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-02-08 09:12:07.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Remove a py34 environment from tox

The gating on python 3.4 is restricted to <= Mitaka. This is due to
the change from Ubuntu Trusty to Xenial, where only python3.5 is
available. So we can drop py34 environment from tox.

Change-Id: I5e4ed5b4e8e90266813c047d6502d2e7f9b7eb59
'}]
commit_message:
Remove a py34 environment from tox

The gating on python 3.4 is restricted to <= Mitaka. This is due to
the change from Ubuntu Trusty to Xenial, where only python3.5 is
available. So we can drop py34 environment from tox.

Change-Id: I5e4ed5b4e8e90266813c047d6502d2e7f9b7eb59

subject: Pass session directly to swiftclient
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-07 10:55:26.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/common/swift.py', 'ironic/tests/unit/common/test_swift.py'], 'message': 'Pass session directly to swiftclient

since v3.2.0 swiftclient supports instantiating the API client from
keystonauth session, and we already require this version as minimal in
ironic.

This patch removes existing workarounds in SwiftAPI code which were there
only to accomodate for absence of session handling in swiftclient,
and now the keystoneauth session built from the [swift] config section
is used directly to instantiate the swift API client.

Change-Id: I52f1386df45ebe0a43b11fe1583e012dfa3af532
Related-Bug: #1518938
'}]
commit_message:
Pass session directly to swiftclient

since v3.2.0 swiftclient supports instantiating the API client from
keystonauth session, and we already require this version as minimal in
ironic.

This patch removes existing workarounds in SwiftAPI code which were there
only to accomodate for absence of session handling in swiftclient,
and now the keystoneauth session built from the [swift] config section
is used directly to instantiate the swift API client.

Change-Id: I52f1386df45ebe0a43b11fe1583e012dfa3af532
Related-Bug: #1518938

commit_message:
Fix for Cookie Bridge not applying ext cookie to flow ops

Wrapper class encompasses the native bridge, instead of composing
it with the native instance inside, and acting as a pass through.
This method was discussed on IRC, and details of the discussion
can be seen along with the bug details.

Refactored the cookie classes to native and ofctl versions derived
from corresponding integration and tunnel bridge classes.
The derived classes implementing cookie filtering functionality
gets instantiated/composed with the native bridge instances at
runtime, subsequent to their creation.

This should prevent the cookie aware calls not being called from
within the agent extension code.

Change-Id: I721e81e53028cc42b9c0ca274aafa4482a60dfe6
Closes-Bug: #1557620

commit_message:
Revert "Adjust MTU to compensate for VLAN tag issue"

This reverts commit 4223b88b708e145c1dcdc38e4209ecc9029dd91f.

The underlying neutron bug with native ofctl interface was fixed in Newton.
We no longer need to dumb down deployment MTU to accommodate Neutron.

Change-Id: I9082c2d198a02ac3321488df67a66d336556d64c

commit_message:
Migrate testing to ostestr and adding docs

Following commits not only enables running
unit tests with ostestr, like other
OS projects, but also:
* enables covarage with testr
* enables building documentation with build_sphinx commands

Additionally:
* tox.ini was organized a bit
* (cherry picked commit 0db2f1cd2adeabe55089b94458f5b70d58f7d281)

Needed-By: Ie289f5ca3d82a3150a0d0f8b8284385efe6ae4b2

(cherry picked from commit 04030115dbc2ba986529d7bb5a8f4dcd1d497aca)

commit_message:
Environment creation procedure modification

Sometimes installation of environment failed
because storage volume(s) exists already.
The issue is hard-to-reproduce. Some logging and
setting internal attribute _virt_env were added.

Change-Id: Ib49c904ca7c961617f0f328230c2658a13bfdecf
Related-Bug: 1566966
(cherry picked from commit 1b2d807336f41d0d319f273790c708ce2929d1c5)

commit_message:
Environment creation procedure modification

Sometimes installation of environment failed
because storage volume(s) exists already.
The issue is hard-to-reproduce. Some logging and
setting internal attribute _virt_env were added.

Change-Id: Ib49c904ca7c961617f0f328230c2658a13bfdecf
Related-Bug: 1566966
(cherry picked from commit 1b2d807336f41d0d319f273790c708ce2929d1c5)

As per OpenStack licensing guide lines [1]:
[H104] Files with no code shouldn't contain any license header nor

the Apache 2.0 license.

Change-Id: I90cb2e6fa3bf560278e26419dd05ba2a6b35ff6a

commit_message:
Files with no code must be left completely empty

As per OpenStack licensing guide lines [1]:
[H104] Files with no code shouldn't contain any license header nor
comments, and must be left completely empty.
[H102 H103] Newly contributed Source Code should be licensed under
the Apache 2.0 license.

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#openstack-licensing

Change-Id: I90cb2e6fa3bf560278e26419dd05ba2a6b35ff6a

subject: Resolved Keystone Federation bugs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-08 03:01:10.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/main.yml', 'library/keystone_sp', 'tasks/keystone_federation_sp_setup.yml'], 'message': 'Resolved Keystone Federation bugs

The keystone role needed a few updates to deal with modern Ansible.

  * The changeset pulls in the needed updates to resolve issues causing
    the keystone_sp plugin, which powers federation, to crash.
  * The changeset pulls in style changes for keystone cert sync removing
    the need for the role to leverage the now deprecated memcached key
    module.

Closes-Bug: 1660626

Change-Id: I29d444c9631a7511123aa6cd521a20a0e7588645
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Resolved Keystone Federation bugs

The keystone role needed a few updates to deal with modern Ansible.

  * The changeset pulls in the needed updates to resolve issues causing
    the keystone_sp plugin, which powers federation, to crash.
  * The changeset pulls in style changes for keystone cert sync removing
    the need for the role to leverage the now deprecated memcached key
    module.

Closes-Bug: 1660626

Change-Id: I29d444c9631a7511123aa6cd521a20a0e7588645
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Remove support for py34

The gating on python 3.4 is restricted to <= Mitaka. This is due to
the change from Ubuntu Trusty to Xenial, where only python3.5 is
available. There is no need to continue to keep these settings.

Change-Id: Ic7878037c0ce53e6870e9351b7a3fd93ee9a8dc0

commit_message:
Remove support for py34

The gating on python 3.4 is restricted to <= Mitaka. This is due to
the change from Ubuntu Trusty to Xenial, where only python3.5 is
available. There is no need to continue to keep these settings.

Change-Id: I37e05189a65f5d86a3149065e6d405a23a4c66b8

commit_message:
Handle log message interpolation by the logger

According to OpenStack Guideline[1], logged string message should be
interpolated by the logger.

[1]: http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/guidelines.html#adding-variables-to-log-messages
Closes-Bug: #1596829

Change-Id: I0c4a2a1cce98dbf78dd30850951466cd01491cfc

commit_message:
Mention Barbican creator role in config reference

A normal user can't create an encrypted volme without the
creator role defined in Barbican's policy.json. This patch
adds this detail to the configuration reference section on
volume encryption.

Change-Id: I947ee10090f11a38c93d7bcde5d590a84e0b972f
Closes-Bug: #1627609

subject: Add custom yaml class
revisions:
[{'number': 12, 'created': '2017-02-08 08:17:13.000000000', 'files': ['tests/unit/common/test_yamlutils.py', 'rally/common/yamlutils.py'], 'message': 'Add custom yaml class

- **duplicate key detection**
  yaml.load('{"a": 1, "a": 2}') == {'a': 2} error should be
  raised in case of duplicate keys.

- **load mappings as OrderedDict**. this allows to run
  workloads in the same order as they are in task file.

Change-Id: Iea05cd84e55c843e461c92c493ebb1342647ed3b
'}]
commit_message:
Add custom yaml class

- **duplicate key detection**
  yaml.load('{"a": 1, "a": 2}') == {'a': 2} error should be
  raised in case of duplicate keys.

- **load mappings as OrderedDict**. this allows to run
  workloads in the same order as they are in task file.

Change-Id: Iea05cd84e55c843e461c92c493ebb1342647ed3b

commit_message:
Update hacking version in test-requirements.txt

This update will allow us to use the hacking extensions
framework. In a subsequent patch, I will update the tox.ini
files [flake8] section to use the currently available extensions.

In nova, we have some own hacking rules which are implemented in
hacking in a more sophisticated way.

The line which updates hacking is from a similar patchset from Trove[1].

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/398935/

commit_message:
Use UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE env var for tests

If the UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE env var exists it should be used
for tests. This is used in nodepool and is a cached version of
the upper constraints file.

It also allows the testing of alternative constraints in jobs.

Change-Id: If2c1143aacb1df098959badc8b41cddc9619c4b3

commit_message:
Prepare for using standard python tests

Add simple script to setup mysql and postgresql databases, this script
can be run by users during testing and will be run by CI systems for
specific setup before running unit tests. This is exactly what is
currently done by OpenStack CI in project-config.

This allows to change in project-config the python-db jobs to
python-jobs since python-jobs will call this script initially.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-November/107784.html

Change-Id: Ib72322030d7dc6979380f74379893084610982a1

subject: Astute do not respect debug option for puppet task
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 3009, 'name': 'Vladimir Kozhukalov', 'email': 'kozhukalov@gmail.com', 'username': 'kozhukalov'}, {'_account_id': 8776, 'name': 'Vladimir Sharshov', 'email': 'vsharshov@mirantis.com', 'username': 'warpc'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10959, 'name': 'Alexander Kislitsky', 'email': 'akislitsky@mirantis.com', 'username': 'akislitsky'}, {'_account_id': 20656, 'name': 'Fuel Packaging CI', 'email': 'ci+fuel-packaging@mirantis.com', 'username': 'fuel-packaging-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 21013, 'name': 'Georgy Kibardin', 'email': 'gkibardin@mirantis.com', 'username': 'gkibardin'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-07 14:18:13.000000000', 'files': ['lib/astute/task.rb', 'lib/astute/tasks/puppet.rb', 'spec/unit/tasks/puppet_task_spec.rb'], 'message': 'Astute do not respect debug option for puppet task

Run cluster with enable debug option do not affect
puppet task which always run with debug disable.

It is happened because Nailgun send debug option which
Astute setup for every task, but puppet task required
puppet_debug option to control it behavior. This code
will connect this parameters.

Change-Id: I8df68105aa699e83673c39a0f03bb22673171d6f
Closes-Bug: #1662512
'}]
commit_message:
Astute do not respect debug option for puppet task

Run cluster with enable debug option do not affect
puppet task which always run with debug disable.

It is happened because Nailgun send debug option which
Astute setup for every task, but puppet task required
puppet_debug option to control it behavior. This code
will connect this parameters.

Change-Id: I8df68105aa699e83673c39a0f03bb22673171d6f
Closes-Bug: #1662512

commit_message:
Rename binary name of neutron-fwaas to neutron-l3-with-fwaas-agent.

/usr/bin/neutron-l3-agent in neutron-fwaas is clashing with
/usr/bin/neutron-l3-agent from python-neutron.

fix it by rename neutron-l3-agent to neutron-l3-with-fwaas-agent.

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1595440

Change-Id: I0ace2eecb6406ce5be38bfcc7dbd21c2a93f5925

commit_message:
Prepare for using standard python tests

Add simple script to setup mysql and postgresql databases, this script
can be run by users during testing and will be run by CI systems for
specific setup before running unit tests. This is exactly what is
currently done by OpenStack CI in project-config.

This allows to change in project-config the python-db jobs to
python-jobs since python-jobs will call this script initially.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-November/107784.html

Needed-By: Ibe74829db04aef9c159a02ac95c1f3889adf75ff

subject: Remove support for py34
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-08 09:02:01.000000000', 'files': ['setup.cfg', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Remove support for py34

The gating on python 3.4 is restricted to <= Mitaka. This is due
to the change from Ubuntu Trusty to Xenial, where only python3.5
is available. There is no need to continue to keep these settings.

Change-Id: Ia3153e89dcf17697e0d1c22619c3282512099fb6
'}]
commit_message:
Remove support for py34

The gating on python 3.4 is restricted to <= Mitaka. This is due
to the change from Ubuntu Trusty to Xenial, where only python3.5
is available. There is no need to continue to keep these settings.

Change-Id: Ia3153e89dcf17697e0d1c22619c3282512099fb6

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-07 17:58:50.000000000', 'files': ['mcagents/puppetd.rb'], 'message': 'Add basemodulepath to the Puppet mcagent

This parameter is required for Puppet 4
to be able to find the base modules without
any environment defined.

Puppet 3 is able to work in the legacy mode
without the environment support and does not
case if there is base module path or not.

Closes-Bug: 1655663
Change-Id: I60f2c78ef5fe366314eea186f4671d198e54f1d6
(cherry picked from commit 1c1578b64a5da7f41e74dee35db9a4d3d4f112ed)
'}]
commit_message:
Add basemodulepath to the Puppet mcagent

This parameter is required for Puppet 4
to be able to find the base modules without
any environment defined.

Puppet 3 is able to work in the legacy mode
without the environment support and does not
case if there is base module path or not.

Closes-Bug: 1655663
Change-Id: I60f2c78ef5fe366314eea186f4671d198e54f1d6
(cherry picked from commit 1c1578b64a5da7f41e74dee35db9a4d3d4f112ed)

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2017-02-06 19:49:18.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/test_plugin.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/db.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/plugin.py'], 'message': "Deprecate get_locked_port_and_binding

This deprecates get_locked_port_and_binding and removes
its usage from ML2.

This function was misleading because it uses with_lockmode('update')
which does not actually block concurrent uses in galera multi-writer
deployments. A lock violation in multi-writer will manifest as a
deadlock at that end.

The revision service plugin already provides us with protection from
concurrent updates within a transaction via a compare and swap on the
revision number that will manifest as a staledataerror in races. This
error can then be retried by the retry decorator in the same way a
deadlock on multi-writer would.

This also will help us avoid trying to carry this db locking into
oslo versioned objects.

Partially-Implements: blueprint adopt-oslo-versioned-objects-for-db
Change-Id: Id9f14db607cc5c6ca02293cb7e87bc1e68301808
"}]
commit_message:
Deprecate get_locked_port_and_binding

This deprecates get_locked_port_and_binding and removes
its usage from ML2.

This function was misleading because it uses with_lockmode('update')
which does not actually block concurrent uses in galera multi-writer
deployments. A lock violation in multi-writer will manifest as a
deadlock at that end.

The revision service plugin already provides us with protection from
concurrent updates within a transaction via a compare and swap on the
revision number that will manifest as a staledataerror in races. This
error can then be retried by the retry decorator in the same way a
deadlock on multi-writer would.

This also will help us avoid trying to carry this db locking into
oslo versioned objects.

Partially-Implements: blueprint adopt-oslo-versioned-objects-for-db
Change-Id: Id9f14db607cc5c6ca02293cb7e87bc1e68301808

This change adds Nodes table action to tag Nodes to a Profile

By selecting nodes in table and clicking 'Tag Nodes' table action,
A form is displayed to let user select from existing profiles or
specify custom one. Available profiles are gathered from the list
of existing profiles on all nodes and roles available in current plan

The way Nodes are stored in app state is slightly changed. Node ports
are normalized into separate map in nodes state. References to them
are stored in 'portsDetail' Node attribute rather than 'ports'

Change-Id: Icc61fbeda133845b5aadef8b749db20c2c411d3a
"}]
commit_message:
Nodes Table tagging

This change adds Nodes table action to tag Nodes to a Profile

By selecting nodes in table and clicking 'Tag Nodes' table action,
A form is displayed to let user select from existing profiles or
specify custom one. Available profiles are gathered from the list
of existing profiles on all nodes and roles available in current plan

The way Nodes are stored in app state is slightly changed. Node ports
are normalized into separate map in nodes state. References to them
are stored in 'portsDetail' Node attribute rather than 'ports'
so in case when node is updated (response does not include nested
ports), the portsDetail won't get overwritten

Partial-Bug: #1640103
Change-Id: Icc61fbeda133845b5aadef8b749db20c2c411d3a

thus benefiting the overall driver performance.

(cherry picked from commit 2d5bad7928a04a5adb2cf06b519a9be0f63ab759)

commit_message:
Remove support for py34

The gating on python 3.4 is restricted to <= Mitaka. This is due
to the change from Ubuntu Trusty to Xenial, where only python3.5
is available. There is no need to continue to keep these settings.

Change-Id: I4d59c60af2a1ccf60e2168a92a4f4f7c2d0a1c14

commit_message:
Deprecated supported_pci_vendor_devs which is removed in neutron

Parameter supported_pci_vendor_devs has no effect in neutron as
it has been removed in Ocata. This patch is deprecating this
parameter and will be removed in future release.
Neutron commit - https://review.openstack.org/#/c/391911/

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-07 08:38:32.000000000', 'files': ['fuel_plugin/testing/tests/integration/test_models_methods.py'], 'message': 'Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using
six.iteritems to achieve iterators. We can use
dict.items instead, as it will return iterators
in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys will more
readable. 2.In py2, the performance about list
should be negligible, see the link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: I7844f6425787388fa37b85b3c0f305b34cddc0fa
(cherry picked from commit 20e93c46864ed0ed4c760cf675db0a45a9220325)
'}]
commit_message:
Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using
six.iteritems to achieve iterators. We can use
dict.items instead, as it will return iterators
in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys will more
readable. 2.In py2, the performance about list
should be negligible, see the link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: I7844f6425787388fa37b85b3c0f305b34cddc0fa
(cherry picked from commit 20e93c46864ed0ed4c760cf675db0a45a9220325)

commit_message:
Add "tearDownClass" call from parent class

The "NeutronBaseTest" class should call
"tearDownClass" method from base class
to initialize "error_msg". The reason is
"AttributeError" for derived classes
if "error_msg" was not initialized.

Change-Id: Ifb78e7902b37f70f6adea6a214f8e440b0ec767f
Closes-Bug: 1604315
(cherry picked from commit 3146c32738b85e86f41e22a3dc17d4acb87b80a7)

commit_message:
Support nova non-live migration

Ensure that each compute node is configured with ssh key
authentication so that the nova compute service can use ssh
to move/resize disks to other nodes.

Change-Id: Ifbefdcbcf865cb2be988e133f19a13a5e010512d
Closes-Bug: #1660981

subject: Update SR-IOV support for >= Mitaka
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2017-02-07 13:55:46.000000000', 'files': ['unit_tests/test_neutron_ovs_utils.py', 'unit_tests/test_neutron_ovs_hooks.py', 'unit_tests/test_pci.py', 'hooks/pci.py', 'unit_tests/test_pci_helper.py', 'hooks/neutron_ovs_context.py', 'hooks/neutron_ovs_hooks.py', 'hooks/neutron_ovs_utils.py', 'config.yaml', 'templates/mitaka/sriov_agent.ini'], 'message': "Update SR-IOV support for >= Mitaka

SR-IOV network for OpenStack release later than Mitaka requires the
use of the neutron-sriov-agent to support management of SR-IOV PF
and VF interface state by Neutron - said interfaces are still
consumed directly by nova-compute/libvirt via PCI device allocation
scheduling for instances.

Add new configuration options to the neutron-openvswitch charm to
support enablement of the SR-IOV agent; this could have been done
automatically from data presented from neutron-api, but its possible
that cloud deployments may only have subsets of compute nodes that
are SR-IOV enabled in terms of hardware.

Enabling this option ('enable-sriov') will install and configure
the neutron-sriov-agent; configuration of SR-IOV PF's are made
using the 'sriov-numvfs', which by default automatically configures
all SR-IOV devices on every machine to the maximum number of VF's
supported by the device.  This option can be used to configure
devices at an individual level as well.

Finally, neutron needs to understand what underlying provider
network each SR-IOV device maps to - this is configured using the
sriov-device-mappings configuration option.

Change-Id: Ie185fd347ddc1b11e9ed13cefaf44fb7c8546ab0
"}]
commit_message:
Update SR-IOV support for >= Mitaka

SR-IOV network for OpenStack release later than Mitaka requires the
use of the neutron-sriov-agent to support management of SR-IOV PF
and VF interface state by Neutron - said interfaces are still
consumed directly by nova-compute/libvirt via PCI device allocation
scheduling for instances.

Add new configuration options to the neutron-openvswitch charm to
support enablement of the SR-IOV agent; this could have been done
automatically from data presented from neutron-api, but its possible
that cloud deployments may only have subsets of compute nodes that
are SR-IOV enabled in terms of hardware.

Enabling this option ('enable-sriov') will install and configure
the neutron-sriov-agent; configuration of SR-IOV PF's are made
using the 'sriov-numvfs', which by default automatically configures
all SR-IOV devices on every machine to the maximum number of VF's
supported by the device.  This option can be used to configure
devices at an individual level as well.

Finally, neutron needs to understand what underlying provider
network each SR-IOV device maps to - this is configured using the
sriov-device-mappings configuration option.

Change-Id: Ie185fd347ddc1b11e9ed13cefaf44fb7c8546ab0

Fix for migration tests

Fixture for migration tests should have "function" type.
There is no "rep_call" attribute for test call
in case of preparation failed. Test results order check
changed accordingly.

commit_message:
Check compute state before migration

Novaclient returns list of hypervisors. We should
check state to discard deleted or disabled
(unavailable) compute nodes for instance migration.

Closes-Bug: 1604749

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-28 05:59:06.000000000', 'files': ['fuel_health/neutronmanager.py'], 'message': 'Add "tearDownClass" call from parent class

The "NeutronBaseTest" class should call
"tearDownClass" method from base class
to initialize "error_msg". The reason is
"AttributeError" for derived classes
if "error_msg" was not initialized.

Change-Id: Ifb78e7902b37f70f6adea6a214f8e440b0ec767f

(cherry picked from commit 3146c32738b85e86f41e22a3dc17d4acb87b80a7)
'}]
commit_message:
Add "tearDownClass" call from parent class

The "NeutronBaseTest" class should call
"tearDownClass" method from base class
to initialize "error_msg". The reason is
"AttributeError" for derived classes
if "error_msg" was not initialized.

Change-Id: Ifb78e7902b37f70f6adea6a214f8e440b0ec767f
Closes-Bug: 1604315
(cherry picked from commit 3146c32738b85e86f41e22a3dc17d4acb87b80a7)

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-02-08 02:38:43.000000000', 'files': ['setup.cfg', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Remove support for py34

The gating on python 3.4 is restricted to <= Mitaka. This is due to
the change from Ubuntu Trusty to Xenial, where only python3.5 is
available. There is no need to continue to keep these settings.

Change-Id: Ibdf002a1f66e1cfabf4f5162ba3edd89b196262d
'}]
commit_message:
Remove support for py34

The gating on python 3.4 is restricted to <= Mitaka. This is due to
the change from Ubuntu Trusty to Xenial, where only python3.5 is
available. There is no need to continue to keep these settings.

Change-Id: Ibdf002a1f66e1cfabf4f5162ba3edd89b196262d

subject: Create ansible-role-fedmsg project
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-06 19:11:25.000000000', 'files': ['gerrit/acls/openstack/ansible-role-fedmsg.config', 'gerritbot/channels.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'gerrit/projects.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'Create ansible-role-fedmsg project

Fedmsg is a brokerless messaging bus created by the Fedora project.
Recently we added support to zuulv3 to report results to it.  As such,
create an ansible role we can use to properly manage fedmsg.

This project is not currently part of the big tent, but will be used
under the existing windmill ansible roles.  We are also adding IRC
notifications into the #windmill channel.

Change-Id: I646e93a19216574d5750a06ed2138df4ed3b7b00
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Create ansible-role-fedmsg project

Fedmsg is a brokerless messaging bus created by the Fedora project.
Recently we added support to zuulv3 to report results to it.  As such,
create an ansible role we can use to properly manage fedmsg.

This project is not currently part of the big tent, but will be used
under the existing windmill ansible roles.  We are also adding IRC
notifications into the #windmill channel.

Change-Id: I646e93a19216574d5750a06ed2138df4ed3b7b00
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Support VNF create from inline template

Accept transient VNFD template as part of VNF creation without
need for VNFD onboarding into Tacker VNFD catalog.

Change-Id: I3c8bbe139dec27adbfc943d3ac9f909db8097f89
Implements: blueprint vnf-inline-template
Depends-On: I719237dd04dd7fe13fb7e7964402d7074679b2d6

commit_message:
Add networking-cisco tests for stable/ocata

This patch adds the new test job to test networking-cisco against

release.

commit_message:
Timeout changing for restart procedure

We have few tests failed on call "warm_shutdown_nodes"
with 4x60 timeout. But there are few rassed tests with
10x60 timeout. So longer timeout should be used for
all tests.

commit_message:
xiv delete cg fails if removed on backend

If a consistency group object is deleted on the XIV backend,
a following call to the driver delete_consistencygroup function
will fail and leave the CG in error state.

Change-Id: I4bb381fdc73d6d470bec662913aa9eeb7d10ffb8
closes-bug: 1661194

subject: Fix up doc errors
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-02-08 05:07:17.000000000', 'files': ['elements/partitioning-sfdisk/README.rst', 'doc/source/index.rst', 'doc/source/specs/v1/approved/block-device-overview.rst', 'elements/rhel7/README.rst', 'doc/source/specs/v1/approved/block-device-lvl1-partitioning.rst', 'elements/python-brickclient/README.rst', 'elements/cloud-init/README.rst', 'doc/source/specs/README.rst', 'elements/debian-minimal/README.rst'], 'message': 'Fix up doc errors

It seems that pbr's "warnerrors" isn't actually doing anything at the
moment (I680b448471e687919d202e8f2abe57f8ba3b22ee) meaning we're able
to commit docs with RST parser errors.  Fix all these up in some
minimal way (I have not audited content, just made it pass build).

Link the specs in so they're referenced from the top level.

Change-Id: Id67b9ea7ba8f49b43969c58ca3fb7fa1243538a4
'}]
commit_message:
Fix up doc errors

It seems that pbr's "warnerrors" isn't actually doing anything at the
moment (I680b448471e687919d202e8f2abe57f8ba3b22ee) meaning we're able
to commit docs with RST parser errors.  Fix all these up in some
minimal way (I have not audited content, just made it pass build).

Link the specs in so they're referenced from the top level.

Change-Id: Id67b9ea7ba8f49b43969c58ca3fb7fa1243538a4

subject: Remove support for py34
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-08 07:07:22.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Remove support for py34	

The gating on python 3.4 is restricted to <= Mitaka. This is due
to the change from Ubuntu Trusty to Xenial, where only python3.5
is available. There is no need to continue to keep these settings.

Change-Id: Ibb692b2e91451590a6bae3ff0b658e980b8d39df
'}]
commit_message:
Remove support for py34	

The gating on python 3.4 is restricted to <= Mitaka. This is due
to the change from Ubuntu Trusty to Xenial, where only python3.5
is available. There is no need to continue to keep these settings.

Change-Id: Ibb692b2e91451590a6bae3ff0b658e980b8d39df

commit_message:
Fix "module list --all" failed

KeyError cause the command "module list --all" failed,
fix it, and do refactor to filter private modules and
reduce the loop times, add related unit tests and
functional tests.

Change-Id: Icd77739502e05b5f763a04a92547497bf82d5d63
Closes-Bug: #1661814

commit_message:
implement a collectd composable service

The collectd composable service permits an operator to configure
collectd metrics collection as part of the overcloud install.

subject: allow centos-opstools repo to be enabled for multinode jobs
revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2017-02-03 20:27:01.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/common_functions.sh', 'scripts/tripleo.sh', 'toci_gate_test.sh'], 'message': "allow centos-opstools repo to be enabled for multinode jobs

The ci tests for collectd, fluentd, and sensu all require that the
centos-opstools SIG repository be enabled.  We're running those tests
as part of ci/environments/scenario001-multinode.yaml, so this change
only enables the opstools repo for scenario001.

Change-Id: I03cfbd96778a76125d18e2ca2f48d96e292608de
"}]
commit_message:
allow centos-opstools repo to be enabled for multinode jobs

The ci tests for collectd, fluentd, and sensu all require that the
centos-opstools SIG repository be enabled.  We're running those tests
as part of ci/environments/scenario001-multinode.yaml, so this change
only enables the opstools repo for scenario001.

Change-Id: I03cfbd96778a76125d18e2ca2f48d96e292608de

commit_message:
Fix up element doc generation

Turns out that you really have to have the elements dir symlinked
under the source directory for the globbing to match anything.  AFAICT
there's no way to add external directories to the sphinx build.

Change-Id: Iaa3576ef250822b0d57bebce1ebbe03e5bafa042

commit_message:
Add retries for horizon venv download

Previous horizon attempt download venv from repo without retries.
This would simply fail when common HTTP 503 happens. This patch
will give more deplay and chance to let download go through.

Change-Id: I0c38d23c9981e1cc92a12bcf5bff34edd9828a0b
Closes-Bug: 1661374
(cherry picked from commit a68a8ea830f010d29b36eb325a1d64f6222529eb)

Avoid dangerous file parsing and object serialization libraries.
yaml.load is the obvious function to use but it is dangerous[1]
Because yaml.load return Python object may be dangerous if you
receive a YAML document from an untrusted source such as the
Internet. The function yaml.safe_load limits this ability to
simple Python objects like integers or lists.

In addition, Bandit flags yaml.load() as security risk so replace
all occurrences with yaml.safe_load(). Thus I replace yaml.load()
with yaml.safe_load()

[1]https://security.openstack.org/guidelines/dg_avoid-dangerous-input-parsing-libraries.html

Change-Id: Ieeae707cc617bcbc1a61957645280d42e2e807f4
Closes-Bug: #1634265
'}]
commit_message:
Replace yaml.load() with yaml.safe_load()

Avoid dangerous file parsing and object serialization libraries.
yaml.load is the obvious function to use but it is dangerous[1]
Because yaml.load return Python object may be dangerous if you
receive a YAML document from an untrusted source such as the
Internet. The function yaml.safe_load limits this ability to
simple Python objects like integers or lists.

In addition, Bandit flags yaml.load() as security risk so replace
all occurrences with yaml.safe_load(). Thus I replace yaml.load()
with yaml.safe_load()

[1]https://security.openstack.org/guidelines/dg_avoid-dangerous-input-parsing-libraries.html

Change-Id: Ieeae707cc617bcbc1a61957645280d42e2e807f4
Closes-Bug: #1634265

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2017-02-07 17:03:38.000000000', 'files': ['kuryr_kubernetes/tests/unit/test_k8s_client.py', 'kuryr_kubernetes/k8s_client.py'], 'message': "Resolve 'resourceVersion' conflicts

It is possible for K8s resource to be updated while it is being
processed by Kuryr handler. As a result K8sClient will fail to
update annotations after the handler finishes its work due to the
'resourceVersion' conflict.

This patch updates K8sClient to allow annotation updates with
conflicting 'resourceVersion' if the updated annotations do not
conflict with the current state (i.e. annotations are either new
or have the same value as in the current state of the object).

Change-Id: I6db14169bf8d6a8114a991bca9c220e15fccdce4
Co-Authored-By: Antoni Segura Puimedon <antonisp@celebdor.com>
Closes-Bug: #1662448
"}]
commit_message:
Resolve 'resourceVersion' conflicts

It is possible for K8s resource to be updated while it is being
processed by Kuryr handler. As a result K8sClient will fail to
update annotations after the handler finishes its work due to the
'resourceVersion' conflict.

This patch updates K8sClient to allow annotation updates with
conflicting 'resourceVersion' if the updated annotations do not
conflict with the current state (i.e. annotations are either new
or have the same value as in the current state of the object).

Change-Id: I6db14169bf8d6a8114a991bca9c220e15fccdce4
Co-Authored-By: Antoni Segura Puimedon <antonisp@celebdor.com>
Closes-Bug: #1662448

commit_message:
Implement _process_unfinished_notifications periodic tasks

Added _process_unfinished_notifications to process notifications
which are in error or new state. This periodic task will execute at
regular interval defined by new config option
'process_unfinished_notifications_interval' defaults to 120 seconds.

The notifications which are in ‘new’ status will be picked up based
on a new config option ‘retry_notification_new_status_interval’ defaults
to 60 seconds.

Implements: bp add-periodic-tasks
Change-Id: I6e607d83f04618ad695a9614f84ad690b8804848

subject: Semi-automatic doc generation of element dependency
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-01-23 20:05:07.000000000', 'files': ['elements/debootstrap/README.rst', 'releasenotes/notes/doc-auto-element-dependency-cb7488c5bb7301a4.yaml', 'elements/ubuntu/README.rst', 'doc/source/conf.py', 'elements/ubuntu-minimal/README.rst', 'elements/debian-upstart/README.rst', 'elements/debian/README.rst', 'doc/lib/element_deps.py', 'elements/ubuntu-core/README.rst', 'elements/debian-systemd/README.rst', 'elements/dpkg/README.rst', 'releasenotes/notes/doc-auto-element-dependency-7eaac1ad5a20ebc4.yaml', 'tox.ini', 'elements/debian-minimal/README.rst'], 'message': "Semi-automatic doc generation of element dependency

Currently there is no description of dependencies in the generated
documentation of the elements: therefore a user of an element does not
know which other elements are automatically included and e.g. which
configuration options are available. In addition there are some
copy&pastes of parts of the README.rst scattered thought different
Ubuntu and Debian specific elements.

This patch adds a semi-automatic generation of dependency information
of all elements.  Nevertheless these are not automatically included.
The author of the element's README.rst can decide if and where the
dependency information should appear and can use the construct
.. element_deps::
for this.

This patch adds the dependency information for some Debian and
Ubuntu patches - and creates the base for later removing the
duplicated parts.

Change-Id: I31d2b6050b6c46fefe37378698e9a330025db430
Signed-off-by: Andreas Florath <andreas@florath.net>
"}]
commit_message:
Semi-automatic doc generation of element dependency

Currently there is no description of dependencies in the generated
documentation of the elements: therefore a user of an element does not
know which other elements are automatically included and e.g. which
configuration options are available. In addition there are some
copy&pastes of parts of the README.rst scattered thought different
Ubuntu and Debian specific elements.

This patch adds a semi-automatic generation of dependency information
of all elements.  Nevertheless these are not automatically included.
The author of the element's README.rst can decide if and where the
dependency information should appear and can use the construct
.. element_deps::
for this.

This patch adds the dependency information for some Debian and
Ubuntu patches - and creates the base for later removing the
duplicated parts.

Change-Id: I31d2b6050b6c46fefe37378698e9a330025db430
Signed-off-by: Andreas Florath <andreas@florath.net>

commit_message:
Check if user.token attribute exists

If the user is admin or don't have an ID the identity panel
will be loaded. In any other case  the project panel will be loaded.
This will also check if the panel is unregistred, and if the
session has expired it will lead to the login screen.

Closes-Bug: #1659818
Change-Id: I27300e928855ec10ca5d2a623d636e50d756b698
(cherry picked from commit a2386d80fbbff2cd3ab3814cd850a8471280dde8)

commit_message:
Remove deprecated calls to novaclient.v2.contrib

As from OpenStack Ocata calls to novaclient.v2.contrib.instance_action
and novaclient.v2.contrib.list_extensions are deprecated
in favour of novaclient.v2.instance_action and
novaclient.v2.list_extensions respectively

Closes-bug: #1661767

Change-Id: I75d89a897093ef24fdb7f2c4a7c29c00fb3b2327
(cherry picked from commit 900a46064ecdf9453092c81167b2eb5d645b0ca9)

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-02-07 15:45:34.000000000', 'files': ['api-ref/source/v2-ext/parameters.yaml', 'api-ref/source/v2-admin/parameters.yaml', 'api-ref/source/v3/parameters.yaml', 'api-ref/source/v3-ext/parameters.yaml'], 'message': "Remove unused api parameters

This patch removes any unused parameters in the v2 and v3 api's.
In order to find which parameters were unused, I wrote a script
that found all the parameters used in the `parameters.yaml` files,
then is searched the same api directory (ex: v3/, v3-ext/, etc.)
for any reference to these parameters. Anything unreferenced was
flagged and then removed.

Script: http://cdn.pasteraw.com/8cdh0e76aqhtliuh874veautr7as8k7

Change-Id: I1558ac94e1041f9fbb1d6713b394c4f97f997ada

commit_message:
Remove unused api parameters

This patch removes any unused parameters in the v2 and v3 api's.
In order to find which parameters were unused, I wrote a script
that found all the parameters used in the `parameters.yaml` files,
then is searched the same api directory (ex: v3/, v3-ext/, etc.)
for any reference to these parameters. Anything unreferenced was
flagged and then removed.

Script: http://cdn.pasteraw.com/8cdh0e76aqhtliuh874veautr7as8k7

Change-Id: I1558ac94e1041f9fbb1d6713b394c4f97f997ada

commit_message:
Remove python 3.4 support

The gating on python 3.4 is restricted to <= Mitaka. There is no
need to continue to keep these settings.

From Newton onwards we are gating on python 3.5.

Change-Id: Ib6e6c62212796f493bb99fb3c5e39ab4f2e45cfc

subject: Replace six.iteritems() with .items()
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-07 12:32:00.000000000', 'files': ['manilaclient/tests/unit/v2/test_shell.py', 'manilaclient/v2/security_services.py', 'manilaclient/v2/services.py', 'manilaclient/v2/share_networks.py', 'manilaclient/common/apiclient/auth.py', 'manilaclient/common/cliutils.py', 'manilaclient/v2/client.py', 'manilaclient/common/apiclient/exceptions.py', 'manilaclient/v2/share_servers.py', 'manilaclient/v1/client.py', 'manilaclient/common/apiclient/base.py', 'manilaclient/tests/functional/test_share_networks.py'], 'message': 'Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using
six.iteritems to achieve iterators. We can
use dict.items instead, as it will return
iterators in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys
will more readable. 2.In py2, the performance
about list should be negligible, see the link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: I159cf82541e43468b106e8e22373a0a24a4f6a53
'}]
commit_message:
Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using
six.iteritems to achieve iterators. We can
use dict.items instead, as it will return
iterators in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys
will more readable. 2.In py2, the performance
about list should be negligible, see the link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: I159cf82541e43468b106e8e22373a0a24a4f6a53

commit_message:
Set client module __version__

According to PEP 396, the version of client library
should be set in xxxclient.__version__, that help
python-openstackclient command "module list" to get
the right plugin module versions.

Change-Id: Iea53e561ab197f4ef1b4855422c748417d808fab
Partial-Bug: #1662058

commit_message:
Enhance the description of supported network type in networking guide

1. What is the problem
Currently the reader of the networking guide documentation may be
confused what kind of network type can be supported for different
purpose.

2. What is the solution to the problem
Add summary of network types supported in Tricircle for different
networking purpose.

3. What the features need to be implemented to the Tricircle
No new features

Change-Id: I9590b9d6609e89d3ab723030c7c07cbd907a1759
Signed-off-by: joehuang <joehuang@huawei.com>

subject: pseudo agent: don't set start_flag
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-07 19:25:08.000000000', 'files': ['networking_odl/ml2/pseudo_agentdb_binding.py'], 'message': "pseudo agent: don't set start_flag

pseudo agent update agent db always with start_flag=True.
This causes test_list_agent to fails. It assumes that start_at isn't
updated once the row created as long as agent is alive.
So don't set start_flags once the row is created/update at first time
when updating agentdb.

Change-Id: Ieb14ab71fe7f373efe1202c972228fc72de453f3
Closes-bug: #1662638
"}]
commit_message:
pseudo agent: don't set start_flag

pseudo agent update agent db always with start_flag=True.
This causes test_list_agent to fails. It assumes that start_at isn't
updated once the row created as long as agent is alive.
So don't set start_flags once the row is created/update at first time
when updating agentdb.

Change-Id: Ieb14ab71fe7f373efe1202c972228fc72de453f3
Closes-bug: #1662638

commit_message:
Create a config drive to test the metadata code

Because it's not possible to test the metadata service
code in an easy way, create a config drive ISO image for
test purposes.

Also speed up the metadata code to not block while waiting
for the metadata service and to exit quickly when there is
no config drive CD present.

Change-Id: If6a5565825b67de58715e3d2de1cbf69b7f9e551

commit_message:
Fix wrong behavior of parsing plugin service name

When the service name end with keyword "os", like: antiddos,
the parsing logic isn't suitable, that cause the service api
version specified by users don't work.

Change-Id: I5d6217c77d7cd2d2f360d78d8561261398b96685
Closes-Bug: #1658614

commit_message:
Using yaml.safe_load instead of yaml.load

It is not safe to call yaml.load with any data received from
an untrusted source, we'd better use yaml.safe_load

Reference:
https://security.openstack.org/guidelines/dg_avoid-dangerous-input-parsing-libraries.html

Change-Id: I7c5ff469187c82c73527f207a234ee4f766e4083

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-01-31 09:42:14.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/compute/test_serversV21.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/servers.py'], 'message': "Fix unspecified bahavior on GET /servers/detail?tenant_id=X as admin

When an admin calls /v2.1/servers/detail?tenant_id=XX, then the
`get_all` method of nova.compute.api.API is called with 2
conflicting search options: {'tenant_id': XX, 'project_id': YY}.
But because, latter on, in that `get_all` method we define a dict
called filter_mapping, on which we iter upon, which value takes
precedence depends on the order in which the dict is iterated upon.

As the order in unpredictable and varies between Py2 and Py3, this
is problematic. Especially, on Python 2 hash randomization is
disabled by default but it's enabled by default on Py3 (unless
the PYTHONHASHSEED env var is set to a fixed value) [0]

The (unreliable) order we iterate on items of that `filter_mapping`
dict is why the Tempest test_list_servers_by_admin_with_specified_tenant
test randomly fails on Py35.

This patch ensures that, if the all_tenants search option is
not set, then the `tenant_id` search option is ignored. Note that
this *is* the current behavior on Py27, as documented in lp:#1185290
and tested by Tempest here [1].

[0] https://docs.python.org/dev/using/cmdline.html#cmdoption-R
[1] https://github.com/openstack/tempest/blob/fe1a8e289c2d79df29beaa6b3603afe5feb60fb3/tempest/api/compute/admin/test_servers.py#L96

Change-Id: I1a74ef0f16da14444029c0f184b433df367ffb41
Closes-Bug: #1659811
"}]
commit_message:
Fix unspecified bahavior on GET /servers/detail?tenant_id=X as admin

When an admin calls /v2.1/servers/detail?tenant_id=XX, then the
`get_all` method of nova.compute.api.API is called with 2
conflicting search options: {'tenant_id': XX, 'project_id': YY}.
But because, latter on, in that `get_all` method we define a dict
called filter_mapping, on which we iter upon, which value takes
precedence depends on the order in which the dict is iterated upon.

As the order in unpredictable and varies between Py2 and Py3, this
is problematic. Especially, on Python 2 hash randomization is
disabled by default but it's enabled by default on Py3 (unless
the PYTHONHASHSEED env var is set to a fixed value) [0]

The (unreliable) order we iterate on items of that `filter_mapping`
dict is why the Tempest test_list_servers_by_admin_with_specified_tenant
test randomly fails on Py35.

This patch ensures that, if the all_tenants search option is
not set, then the `tenant_id` search option is ignored. Note that
this *is* the current behavior on Py27, as documented in lp:#1185290
and tested by Tempest here [1].

[0] https://docs.python.org/dev/using/cmdline.html#cmdoption-R
[1] https://github.com/openstack/tempest/blob/fe1a8e289c2d79df29beaa6b3603afe5feb60fb3/tempest/api/compute/admin/test_servers.py#L96

Change-Id: I1a74ef0f16da14444029c0f184b433df367ffb41
Closes-Bug: #1659811

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-04 09:42:21.000000000', 'files': ['senlinclient/common/utils.py'], 'message': 'Replaces yaml.load() with yaml.safe_load()

Yaml.load() return Python object may be dangerous if you receive
a YAML document from an untrusted source such as the Internet.
The function yaml.safe_load() limits this ability to simple Python
objects like integers or lists.

Reference:
https://security.openstack.org/guidelines/dg_avoid-dangerous-input-parsing-libraries.html

Change-Id: Ie3e632bef72f02f7895b6d46215111b8dc4d3a6a
'}]
commit_message:
Replaces yaml.load() with yaml.safe_load()

Yaml.load() return Python object may be dangerous if you receive
a YAML document from an untrusted source such as the Internet.
The function yaml.safe_load() limits this ability to simple Python
objects like integers or lists.

Reference:
https://security.openstack.org/guidelines/dg_avoid-dangerous-input-parsing-libraries.html

Change-Id: Ie3e632bef72f02f7895b6d46215111b8dc4d3a6a

subject: Check source_type and destination_type when booting with bdm provided
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-12-07 09:20:27.000000000', 'files': ['novaclient/v2/shell.py', 'novaclient/tests/unit/v2/test_shell.py'], 'message': 'Check source_type and destination_type when booting with bdm provided

When booting instance with block_device_mapping provided,
in the current implementation, the "destination_type" is
allowed to be None, and this lead to un-sync between Nova
and Cinder: Nova will have a bdm in its record while the
volume is still in "available" status in cinder.

Also we should check source_type here

This patch adds a check for source_type and
destination_type, source_type shoud be within
'volume', 'image', 'snapshot' or 'blank';
When empty destination_type is provided, it
will be assigned to an default value according
to source_type, if it is provided with a wrong
value, command error will raise and information
will shown.

Change-Id: If6c7d8ed58a94d262ac6c300e75aca4cdf99ff1d
partial-bug: #1644725
'}]
commit_message:
Check source_type and destination_type when booting with bdm provided

When booting instance with block_device_mapping provided,
in the current implementation, the "destination_type" is
allowed to be None, and this lead to un-sync between Nova
and Cinder: Nova will have a bdm in its record while the
volume is still in "available" status in cinder.

Also we should check source_type here

This patch adds a check for source_type and
destination_type, source_type shoud be within
'volume', 'image', 'snapshot' or 'blank';
When empty destination_type is provided, it
will be assigned to an default value according
to source_type, if it is provided with a wrong
value, command error will raise and information
will shown.

Change-Id: If6c7d8ed58a94d262ac6c300e75aca4cdf99ff1d
partial-bug: #1644725

commit_message:
Remove a py34 environment from tox

The gating on python 3.4 is restricted to <= Mitaka. This is due to
the change from Ubuntu Trusty to Xenial, where only python3.5 is
available. There is no need to continue to keep these settings.

Change-Id: Ida4353229c8a1383674cc580bef87a22fa97a7c3

commit_message:

Following a similar fix to pip-and-virtualenv element in
Ia730850a48e2478fd5461710a9d2619408725cd8, python-brickclient is also
required to be fixed to handle python3 only systems.

Change-Id: I442469beb5a20074425e7059eec7f78604d6cc5a

commit_message:
Replace yaml.load() with yaml.safe_load()

Avoid dangerous file parsing and object serialization libraries.
yaml.load is the obvious function to use but it is dangerous[1]
Because yaml.load return Python object may be dangerous if you
receive a YAML document from an untrusted source such as the
Internet. The function yaml.safe_load limits this ability to
simple Python objects like integers or lists.

In addition, Bandit flags yaml.load() as security risk so replace
all occurrences with yaml.safe_load(). Thus I replace yaml.load()
with yaml.safe_load()

[1]https://security.openstack.org/guidelines/dg_avoid-dangerous-input-parsing-libraries.html

Change-Id: I001f4b4f269671afa86f7012fca7d91927bffa69
Closes-Bug: #1634265
